input.description: timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs

key[Required] This tag contains the event attribute by which the events are filtered. Valid values - Id,OriginalId,MonitoringObjectId,MonitoringClassId,MonitoringObjectName,MonitoringObjectDisplayName,MonitoringObjectPath, MonitoringObjectFullName,MonitoringRuleId,PublisherName,Number,CategoryId,User,Channel,LevelId,LoggingComputer,EventData,ManagementGroupId
value[Required] This tag contains the valid search expression for the attribute specified in the key.

operator[Required] The 'operator' tag specified under 'event-search-criteria' tag specifies the operand between multiple 'criteria-expression' tags. Valid values - and, or
The 'operator' tag specified under 'criteria-expression specifies the operand for key and value specified. Valid values - equals, not equals, like, in NOTE: 'in' operator should only be used when 'Id' is used as key
isrecurse[Optional] If true, retrieves events for contained monitoring objects in addition to current monitoring object. Valid values - true, false

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">get-event</xsl:text> </operation-name> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeout secs}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <event-search-criteria> <criteria-expression> <key> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok1}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </key> <value> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok2}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </value> <operator> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok3}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </operator> </criteria-expression> </event-search-criteria> <isrecurse> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok4}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </isrecurse> </command-parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Utility to create items xml for the process - "Fine Event"
